getLegalSingleLetter

public static java.lang.String getLegalSingleLetter(java.lang.String pattern,
                                                    java.lang.String letter,
                                                    boolean allowEmpty)
Returns one legal letter specified in the given pattern. If the given letter is not null, one character and contained in the given pattern then it returns the letter. Otherwise it returns a empty string if allowEmpty is true or returns the first character of the given pattern instead if allowEmpty is false.

Parameters:
pattern - the pattern of all legal values
letter - the letter which needs to be checked
allowEmpty - allows to return a empty string if true or return the first character of the given pattern if false when not found
Returns:
one legal letter specified in the given pattern
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the given pattern is empty
